intro: Antirrhinum glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or grassy habitats. Antirrhinum glandulosum is cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens.
